DOC.brief_summary: The investigators hypothesized that positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP) would increase the regional oxygen saturation (rSO2).
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Positive End Expiratory Pressure (PEEP) on Cerebral Oxymetry During Laparoscopy
DOC.detailed_description: The investigators hypothesized that PEEP would increase the rSO2 during laparoscopic surgery by improving oxygenation.
DOC.criteria: ASA PS I or II adult patient undergoing laparoscopic low anterior resection with Trendelenburg position Patients with history of cerebrovascular disease, coronary occlusive disease and/or obesity (body mass index > 30) were excluded from this study.
